com.lukflug.panelstudio.mc8forge

Class GLInterface

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.lukflug.panelstudio.mc8forge.GLInterface
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Interface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MinecraftGUI.GUIInterface

    public abstract class GLInterface
extends java.lang.Object
implements Interface
    Implementation of Interface for OpenGL in minecraft.

      • fillTriangle

        public void fillTriangle(java.awt.Point pos1,
                         java.awt.Point pos2,
                         java.awt.Point pos3,
                         java.awt.Color c1,
                         java.awt.Color c2,
                         java.awt.Color c3)
        Description copied from interface: Interface
        Draw a triangle on the screen. The color of the triangle should ideally be smoothly interpolated. May only be called in a GUI rendering method.
        Specified by:
        fillTriangle in interface Interface
        Parameters:
        pos1 - the first corner of the triangle
        pos2 - the second corner of the triangle
        pos3 - the third corner of the triangle
        c1 - the color at the first corner
        c2 - the color at the second corner
        c3 - the color at the third corner

      • loadImage

        public int loadImage(java.lang.String name)
        Description copied from interface: Interface
        Load an image into memory and return a number that may be used to draw that image. Should only be called during initialization. The name string should ideally be the filename of the image, not including the path, since the implementation of this interface must ideally provide the directory in which the images are located.
        Specified by:
        loadImage in interface Interface
        Parameters:
        name - a string indicating the location of the image to be loaded
        Returns:
        a number identifying the image
        See Also:
        Interface.drawImage(Rectangle, int, boolean, int)

      • drawImage

        public void drawImage(java.awt.Rectangle r,
                      int rotation,
                      boolean parity,
                      int image)
        Description copied from interface: Interface
        Draw an image.
        Specified by:
        drawImage in interface Interface
        Parameters:
        r - the rectangle specifying the position of the image
        rotation - the rotation of the image in units of 90 degrees counter-clockwise
        parity - if true, will switch the top-left and bottom-right, the bottom-left and top-right corners
        image - the number identifying the image
        See Also:
        Interface.loadImage(String)

      • scissor

        protected void scissor(java.awt.Rectangle r)
        Utility function to set clipping rectangle by projecting the coordinates using gluProject.
        Parameters:
        r - the clipping rectangle

      • window

        public void window(java.awt.Rectangle r)
        Description copied from interface: Interface
        Clip all rendering on screen outside the intersection of the specified rectangle and the current clipping rectangle. May only be called in a GUI rendering method. The calling method should restore clipping by calling Interface.restore() after rendering.
        Specified by:
        window in interface Interface
        Parameters:
        r - the clipping rectangle
        See Also:
        Interface.restore()

      • restore

        public void restore()
        Description copied from interface: Interface
        Restore the clipping to the previous state.
        Specified by:
        restore in interface Interface
        See Also:
        Interface.window(Rectangle)

      • getMatrices

        public void getMatrices()
        Update the matrix buffers.

      • begin

        public static void begin()
        Set OpenGL to the state used by the rendering methods. Should be called before rendering.

      • end

        public static void end()
        Restore OpenGL to the state expected by Minecraft. Should be called after rendering.
